How long is the protection period for new plant varieties?

The Canadian Food Inspection Agency administers the and which provide legal protection to plant breeders for new plant varieties for up to 25 years for a variety of tree and vine (including their rootstocks), and 20 years for all other varieties of plants.

What is the process for obtaining a disposition on land within a Provincial Park?

In Alberta, applications for holding dispositions on land that falls within the boundaries of a Provincial Park fall under different legislation and follow a different administrative process than dispositions issued for public Crown land.

What types of group activities are offered by this program?

Group activities may include, but are not limited to cultural activities (ceremonies like Naming, Walking Out and Welcoming Ceremonies, teachings, medicine walks, medicine picking, access to Elders and Knowledge Holders, spirit painting, storytelling, traditional crafts), workshops (prenatal/postnatal care, parenting, nutrition, child development, family planning, healthy sexuality and relationships, self- care, post-partum depression, lactation, intergenerational trauma, baby food making, anger management, stress management, family violence), and fitness and/or recreational activities (dancing, jigging, gardening, children’s playgroups).
